Company Name Maurice Blackburn Lawyers Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

Summary

Rare opportunity for an enthusiastic and resilient individual to work in our Social Justice practice and make a genuine difference to our clients' lives. Perfect role for a law student available 3 days per week!

Overview

The Firm
Since the day Maurice Blackburn opened our doors nearly a hundred years ago, we’ve been in the business of helping people; fighting to make a genuine difference to people’s lives. We exist to help everyday Australians use the law to fight back against unfair treatment. Our passion for righting wrongs is at the heart of everything we do. This is why we’ve grown to become Australia’s leading social justice law firm. After all, we believe wholeheartedly in what we do.

The Role
We have an exciting opportunity for a Paralegal to join our Social Justice practice on an 18 month contract working 3 days per week. This role will be working towards assisting our Lawyers seek justice for those who are most vulnerable. Working closely with our legal staff to achieve this, your role will involve reviewing discovered and subpoenaed documents, liaising with clients, legal research and document/memo preparation.

Skills & Experience We’re Looking For
  • An understanding of core legal principles
  • Experience working with a diverse client group
  • Prior experience in legal research and document preparation
  • An understanding of court procedures
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to show compassion an empathy for vulnerable clients
  • A passion for social justice.


A Law Firm Like No Other.

Work with people who are truly passionate about the work we do and the impact we have on the community. From the kind of people who work here, to the kind of cases we take on, these values have run deeply throughout our organisation for almost a century.

We also offer great employee benefits, some of which include:
  • Ongoing coaching and career development
  • Fully paid gym membership
  • Salary Continuance & Life Insurance
  • 17.5% Annual Leave Loading
  • Wellbeing Programs for you and your family
  • Generous leave entitlements
  • Health and Wellbeing Leave


How To Apply

Click the ‘Apply’ button and include your resume and cover letter.

Please note applications may close before the advertised closing date.

Company Name Peoplebank Company Location Melbourne, AU

Job description

The Client

We are currently partnering with a Global Digital Transformation consulting practice who focus their business around Customer Experience, New Product Development and Innovation, IT Modernisation and Data & AI based in Melbourne to help them find a Hybris Architect.

Hybris Architect

As a Senior Solutions Architect specializing in Hybris you will translate client requirements into technical designs, implement Intranet, public website, design schemas and integrate with ecommerce solutions and search engines, unlocking the business value of Hybris.

You will drive the translation and construction of clients' business problems into innovative technology solutions by creating and owning the technical vision of a project to ensure that the vision is achieved with a high level of quality. You will lead teams of SMEs to drive transformative change and high quality commercial outcomes for our clients.
You have a genuine appreciation for creativity and an interest in technology and its impact on humankind. You display intellectual curiosity and openness to learn about new industries, new fields, new disciplines and are excited by change and learning.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Architect digital customer experiences using the Hybris platform.
  • Designing small module or a large component and designing a feature, set of features, or whole feature area in Hybris eCommerce and CPQ platform.
  • Work both independently and with the Hybris DevOps team and to other teams across business. Own and lead design discussions for Hybris eCommerce Projects.
  • Translate client requirements into technical designs, design schemas and integrate with content management solutions and search engines.
  • Develop scripts and automation tools used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to Hybris platform
  • Ensure adoption of best-in-class practices and standards for development, support, quality control and documentation and driving development using Agile/Scrum processes.
  • Drive the preparation and delivery of technical stakeholder interviews, client-facing workshops, and other research efforts to determine key functional and non-functional requirements for a project

Experience Guidelines
  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related discipline
  • 4 to 10 years' experience with 2-3 years of content management system and exposure to Hybris.
  • Strong agency, start-up or consulting experience preferred.
  • Comfortable with a variety of processes and approaches like agile development, lean design, and dev ops.
  • Experience implementing all modules of ecommerce (product information, content management, order management, pricing and promotions in B2B, B2C, and B2B2C environments).
  • Experienced in architecting JEE based applications using Spring/OSGi, Hibernate, JMS, REST, SOA, ESB and SSO technologies and extensive implementation knowledge of Software Design Patterns & multi-threaded Asynchronous Programming Models.
  • Comfort with complete application development life-cycle including requirements gathering, analysis and design, development, integration, testing, deployment, maintenance and support.
  • Knowledge of Hybris foundational concepts, data modelling with Hybris and integrations as well as the architecture and implementation of Hybris CPQ module which includes both Product configuration (Variant Configuration) and complex solution configuration for ETO (Engineered to order) product lines.
  • Hands on experience on Hybris Datahub and CPQ platform and Integrating with back end systems like SAP ERP, Oracle ERP, Payment Gateways, Social Media Integration. Experience in Hybris platform v5.5 or later, Spring, Hibernate, JUnit, REST, SOAP, JSON, JAXB, XML, XSLT, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML, CSS. is expected
  • Good organizational, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Understand how technology solves customer problems from both a technology and business perspective.

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 4 views

Job description

  • Over 90 years combined experience in sale or purchase of real estate
  • Working with a great team & company
  • Strong commitment and cost effective services

\xa0

About Us


Located in the North West side of Melbourne CBD, we are a law firm that covers a range of legal services from Commercial Law, Family Law, Litigation, Probate and Conveyancing, we have you covered. Whether our clients are local or out of Melbourne, we are a firm you can rely on for a personalised, reliable and effective service.


We are a family law firm that boasts an outstanding culture and extremely high staff retention. We tailor solution based legal services based on customer needs, ensuring each customer receives a personalised and enhanced experience.

You will develop skills that are transferable and you will be part of a loyal, hard-working, supportive and fun workplace where our staff are encouraged to take on exciting opportunities to learn and train on the job.

\xa0

About the Role


Whether you are helping a client buying, selling or refinancing a property, we are looking for an experienced professional to work part of our conveyancing team. You will be assisting the running of files from instructions to completion subject to the direction of the Principal in a timely manner.


You will be supported by both Senior Conveyancing Exectutives, administration staff and the Principal throughout the process. You will need to be well organised, confident and able to work with minimal supervision in a busy environment.


Reporting to the Principal, you will be working on both purchase and sale files. Your duties include:

  • Preparation of letters and documents including collation of contracts
  • Typing precedent letters and documents using our database
  • Liaise with clients and financial institutions
  • Conduct property searches
  • Coordinating settlements, including booking settlements and finalising figures
  • Preparation of client billing
  • Appeal to a broad database of clients
  • General file, diary and email management
  • Ensure that client records are managed and maintained accurately and timely
  • Manage incoming and outgoing communication
  • Administrative duties including filing, scanning and photocopying

\xa0

Skills and Experience


We are looking for someone who is willing to contribute to a family culture and team. Your skills and experience include:

  • Tertiary qualification in Conveyancing or a similar discipline
  • Minimum 3 years' experience as a Conveyancer
  • Full understanding of legislation and practices
  • Attention to detail, ability to prioritise and a strong sense of urgency
  • Exceptional client relationship management skills
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
  • Capable of handling multiple tasks at once
  • A positive, mature attitude with the ability to negotiate and influence positive outcomes
  • The ability to take instructions and work autonomously
  • A strong work ethic and a strong desire to be a part of a successful team
  • Able to coordinate all aspects of a sale or purchase from initial negotiations through to settlement
  • Able to work independently with limited supervision
  • Must have a proactive positive attitude and work well within a small team

\xa0

Culture and Benefits


  • Support and development opportunities from Principal and Practice
  • Genuine work life balance: the business closes at lunch time for an hour every day
  • Opportunity to be mentored by the director
  • Friendly and supportive team

\xa0

To Apply

If you believe you are the right fit for the role, we would like to hear from you!


Please include in your application, your resume and a cover letter.


Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

[

Organisational Change Manager

Company Name University of Sydney Company Location Camperdown/Darlington , The University of Sydney, NSW 2006, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 126 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Utilise your change management skills in an organisation undertaking significant change
  • Located at Camperdown / Darlinghurst Campus
  • 3-year Fixed Term Contract opportunity, which includes leave loading and up to 17% superannuation

About the opportunity


An opportunity exists for the position of Organisational Change Manager to join the Information and Communications Technology team, to design and deliver Change Management solutions as an integral part of project delivery for the business.

The successful candidate will be responsible for: identifying the appropriate change management approach within the project and business context; leading and managing the change management stream including the design, development and implementation of change management deliverables including communications; managing stakeholder expectations; working with the Project Manager and Project Owner to engage stakeholders and ensure business readiness; and, working collaboratively with other stream leads to identify, understand and facilitate transition activities relevant to the scope and scale of business impacts resulting from the changes being introduced.


About you


The University values courage and creativity; openness and engagement; inclusion and diversity; and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a Change Manager who can/has:

  • Think broadly about change impacts to business within the context of the project/s.
  • Identify barriers to the business initiative and develop change strategies, plans, communications and schedules to effectively overcome these barriers.
  • Ensure sustainable change occurs by understanding the requirements of the business and ensuring key areas are operationally ready.
  • Operational accountability for developing and managing the consistent delivery of the Change Management Plan on time, within budget and to appropriate quality standard.
  • Develop comprehensive ways of leading the change management effort through all stages of the project lifecycle, with particular reference to identifying, investigating and resolving relevant project risks.
  • Develop and deploy solutions that are aligned with the PMO Project framework.
  • Collaborate with the Project Manager and other key leads and seek inputs and feedback on the effectiveness of the Change Management Plan.
  • Establish and maintain an effective partnership approach with customers, departments, vendors, delivery partners and other stakeholders. The approach should emphasise key values including clarifying mutual expectations, developing trust and openness, feedback, continuous improvement, and building capability on how we deliver benefits.

  • Job posted**:

  • Job Description**:
    • **Location Profile**
  • GTAC - The Gene Technology Access Centre** is one of six specialist science and mathematics centres in Victoria. It is located at The University High School in Parkville.
    • GTAC’s focus is to promote a scientifically literate community inspired by experiencing authentic investigations in the life sciences. We provide an innovative and collaborative educational environment in which Victorian students and Educators access life sciences expertise through engagement with practicing scientists and contemporary knowledge and technology.
    GTAC showcases contemporary life science research and careers including focus areas in cell and molecular biology, digital technologies and mathematics, including biotechnology, immunology, bioinformatics, evolutionary biology, microbiology, biochemistry, medical and health sciences, agriculture and predictive modelling.
    GTAC currently has a staff of 11 individuals; Director, Deputy Director, 6 Education Officers, Laboratory and IT Manager and Administration Officer. This is complemented by casual employment of approximately 80 post graduate students who assume the role of Scientist Mentors.

    Please address all 5 Selection Criteria
  • KSC1 **Demonstrated skills in the development of educational life sciences resources for students and teachers (online and print media), including creative utilisation of digital technologies.

  • KSC3 **Demonstrated high level written and verbal communication skills and high level interpersonal skills including a capacity to develop constructive relationships with students, teachers, general public, external stakeholders and external organisations and contribute to the GTAC team.
  • KSC4 **A demonstrated ability to improve the teaching capacity of self and colleagues through pursuing and sharing educational initiatives.
  • KSC5 **Knowledge of current research and practices in the life sciences, including skills in utilising research grade biotechnology equipment and in designing and trialing protocols.

    Develops and delivers public education and teacher professional learning opportunities in collaboration with GTAC staff and external organisations
    **Life Sciences Expertise**
    Assist the GTAC Education team with program development through equipment integration, design of protocols and staff technical training in the areas of biotechnology, digital technologies and mathematics
    **Stakeholder liaison and team development**
    Liaises with internal and external stakeholders to promote GTAC and its activities
    Liaises with the GTAC team for analysis of training and development needs and recommends appropriate programs to deliver GTAC initiatives and outcomes
    Assists in coordinating educational activities and training within the GTAC team to ensure a common approach and uniformity of message with regard to GTAC education initiatives
    Assists to oversee the development and ongoing training of GTAC Education and laboratory staff including casual, volunteer and internship employees
    **Administration**
    Works with the Director and Deputy Director to administer financial, physical and human resources for GTAC programs
    Provides reports and evidence of education program achievements in line with key performance indicators
    Assists in the development of bookings and administration procedures to streamline the program delivery process at GTAC
    **Responsibilities**
    A key responsibility of this position refers to the GTAC Education Program. Our Education program encompasses two modes of delivery:
  • A. Outreach** - refers to educational activities provided at (or for use at) a location remote from our physical facilities
  • B. Onsite** - refers to educational activities delivered at our Facility in Parkville, Melbourne

Job description

Why Pure

We’re here with the humble aspiration to accelerate the speed of human progress with our radically simple, all-flash enterprise storage technology. We’re driven by our belief that storage isn’t just a place to put things, it’s a powerful force to be unleashed - a force that will remove the limitations on those building the world of today, so they can erase the word “impossible” from tomorrow. Our all-flash storage solutions offer radically simple technology to help companies unlock their future possibilities, today.

Our founders created the company with a passion to build storage technology customers love and deliver it with simplicity and service that fundamentally changes the enterprise storage experience. Founded in 2009, our record revenue growth has landed us among a very select group of companies. Today, customers and industries across the world are experiencing the benefits of going Pure - from Barclays to Linkedin.com and ConocoPhillips, Pure adopters cover a broad spectrum from global consumer brands, to healthcare, education and finance.

This Position

Want to be part of the next big thing? Join Pure Storage! We’re seeking a smart, talented, and fun person to join our all-star marketing team.

We are looking for someone to develop and drive the implementation of integrated end-to-end marketing programs that support the key go-to market Marketing and Sales motions, delivering to specific pipeline goals. The ideal candidate should have a keen understanding of B2B marketing, with a strong background in customer acquisition strategies, building creative marketing campaigns, and data analysis. The candidate should also possess knowledge of B2B sales cycles and a solid understanding of driving engagement and lead generation through multiple media channels.

What You Will Be Doing

What You Bring To The Team

 Motivated self-starter who thrives on working in complex and challenging environments of a rapidly evolving business

Company Name genU Company Location Melbourne, AU

Be an early applicant

Job description

About The Company

genU is short for Generation You. Because whatever generation you belong to, whether you’re young, old, or somewhere in between, what unites us is the belief that neither disability nor ageing are disadvantages to be endured but challenges to be met boldly, achievements to be had and adventures in the making.

GenU has been 60 years in the making. Bringing together the best of two trusted and respected organisations, Karingal and St Laurence, genU builds on this experience, adding a new ambition: to become the leader in what we do.

About The Role

The Team Leader will provide inspirational leadership and operational management to our shared supported accommodation homes and ensure an empowering and enabling environment for people with disabilities, whilst still maximising opportunities for the attainment of personal goals and lifestyles that are valued by the wider community.

Reporting to the Operations Manager, the duties of the Team Leader will include:
  • Proactively promote a home like environment that enhances the well-being of people with disabilities and is welcoming of families, friends and other visitors.
  • Undertake program planning and monitoring functions including reviews and written reports as required
  • Develop a productive working relationship to effectively manage up and manage house staff
  • Assist to recruit, induct, develop and support staff working within the facility to ensure that they can meet expectations and support residents
  • Maintain accurate financial records including household expenditure and individual resident personal expenditure


About You
  • Significant experience delivering services in the disability industry
  • Minimum Cert IV in Disability Studies or equivalent
  • Current First Aid- Certificate II Level and CPR certificate
  • Demonstrated ability to provide person centred active supports for residents
  • Working with Children Check
  • Experience leading and managing a team of staff
  • Good computer skills including; in house data base systems, MS office and excel
  • Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills

In applying for this role, you will be subject to a Disability Worker Exclusion Scheme check. This is a check of an individual's name against a database held by the Department of Health and Human Services (DHHS) that records individuals who pose a proven risk to the health, safety or welfare of people with a disability living in group homes. If your name is on or is placed on the list, you will be ineligible to work as a residential disability support worker with Karingal St Laurence.

For further details please contact Joel Scott - 0428 751 865

Project Manager - Windows 10
  • !! ASAP Start !!

The Company

Top 50 ASX listed company is continuing with several projects to update their systems and infrastructure across the board.

This is an Australian-based multinational corporation focusing on advancing and uplifting several departments, creating great programs of work in a large scale environment which will add impressive value to your career portfolio.

The Role

The project is an uplift to the end user devices across the organisation, requiring an experienced technical Project Manager with excellent communication skills.

The role will be based in the very appealing Melbourne CBD office, close to all transport and shops.

During this exciting project, you will also be involved with:
  • Windows 10 security controls for device hardening.
  • End user device application rationalization and packaging.
  • Device personas, allowing different levels of access.
  • Vendor sourcing (including RFP) and vendor management, particularly for end user device hardware suppliers and vendors providing application packaging services.

Required Skills & Experience
  • Proven Project Management background, preferably with certification.
  • Experience of working on a Windows 10 upgrade project including design and build.
  • Experience in vendor sourcing and selection.
  • Experience in deploying end user devices across a global organisation.
  • Senior stakeholder experience, including presenting to steering committees and engaging CIO/CDO leadership.
  • Experience of planning and tracking of scope, schedule, budget and resources.
  • Organisational Change Management experience

Regulatory Strategy Advisor

Company Name nbn™ Australia Company Location North Sydney, Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Are you a great communicator, quick learner and the type of individual who thrives in an environment where change and innovation are at the forefront of everything we do? If so, and you are looking for your next opportunity then nbn has a fantastic opportunity for an Advisor within our Regulatory Strategy team in Sydney, Melbourne or Canberra.

Reporting to the General Manager, Competition, Policy and Regulation, Regulatory Strategy this is a broad role where you will get to advise internal stakeholders as well as work with external stakeholders such as regulators, policy makers, industry, consumer groups and Government.




A bit about your role

 Outlined below are the core duties that the Regulatory Strategy Advisor will be responsible for delivering:

  • Work with the business to identify and analyse any regulatory issues.
  • Provide guidance and education on nbn regulatory matters for internal stakeholders.
  • Provide the business with guidance and education on regulatory matters and ensure internal stakeholders have a clear understanding of their obligations.
  • Contribute to strategic projects to secure favourable regulatory reform for nbn.
  • Assist with developing public and confidential submissions on a range of regulatory and policy matters.
  • Monitor and maintain compliance where appropriate with legislation, standards, frameworks, policies, procedures and controls to ensure that internal stakeholders have an understanding and comply.



A bit about you

 The successful candidate will ideally come from a legal, economics, public policy or finance background and have a couple of years' experience working in a similar role within a regulated industry. You're an exceptional communicator with the ability to think strategically, highly organised and have a track record of building and maintaining collaborative working relationships with a wide range of internal and external of stakeholders. You will also be curious, adaptable, and thrive in an atmosphere of change.



Life at nbn


At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.




Continue the conversation


If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.


nbn is a fast moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!


At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn™ network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.
